intro: Dichaelia breviflora, commonly known as the short-flowered dichaelia, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slight pubescence. D. breviflora is often found in grasslands and rocky habitats, thriving in well-drained soils.
